title: Youth Mental Health Anxiety and Depression

sections.heading: Screening / Assessment
sections.summary: Screen patients aged 12-24 routinely for anxiety and depression. Use questions such as those in theModified Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-4), below,2-5to help determine the need for further assessment. Current evidence does not indicate a recommended screening interval for anxiety and depression. It may be appropriate to screen opportunistically.2More frequent screening may be considered for patients with risk factors/red flags; signs and symptoms; and history of anxiety and/or depression...

subsections.heading: Consent and confidentiality: when to involve parents/legal guardians?

sections.summary: A mature minor has the mental capacity to consent to treatment, understands the nature of the treatment, its intended effect and the consequences of refusing it.To assess, try the “teach-back technique”: ask the youth to rephrase what they have been told and invite them to ask questions. sections.heading: Follow-up and monitoring
sections.summary: When starting patients on psychological therapy or pharmacological therapy primary care providers should follow up the week after initiating treatment to check to see if patient is tolerating treatment. Psychological therapy has a success rate of approximately 70%.4Antidepressants have a success rate of approximately 60-80%.21, 22 Response (defined as 25-50% reduction in symptoms) rates may vary by patient and disorder.
